title: 111_hr3416
content: The Act titled "Disaster Assistance Voting Act of 2009" applies protections for absent military and overseas voters to individuals evacuated due to a major disaster. The Disaster Assistance Voting Act of 2009 grants eligible evacuees the right to use absentee balloting and registration procedures available to military and overseas voters. Evacuees are treated similarly to absent uniformed services voters and overseas voters under the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act, and are deemed entitled to vote by absentee ballot under the National Voter Registration Act of 1993 and the Help America Vote Act of 2002. The Disaster Assistance Voting Act of 2009 allows eligible evacuees to use absentee balloting and registration procedures like military and overseas voters. Evacuees must certify their uninhabitable residence due to a major disaster and intend to return after the election. "Major disaster" is defined by the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act. The Disaster Assistance Voting Act of 2009 applies to elections for Federal office in calendar years starting from 2010 in the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, American Samoa, Guam, and the US Virgin Islands. Grants to states for election administration needs after natural disasters. The Election Assistance Commission will provide grants to eligible States for replacing election supplies damaged by natural disasters and conducting voter outreach. States must certify the damage to receive the grant. The Election Assistance Commission will provide grants to States affected by natural disasters to replace damaged election supplies and conduct voter outreach. States must certify the damage to receive the grant. Preference will be given to states using funds for satellite voting sites for displaced voters outside the disaster area. The term "State" includes several entities, and appropriations are authorized for fiscal years to carry out this section. SEC. 4 amends the National Voter Registration Act to delay removal of registrants from voter lists due to change of residence, including provisions for eligible evacuees under the Disaster Assistance Voting Act of 2009. SEC. 5 requires notifying displaced individuals of their voting protections. Individuals receiving services at designated state voter registration agencies and applicants for housing assistance under the Stafford Act must be notified of their voting protections and requirements, including submitting an affidavit stating their intention to return to their qualified voting residence. The President must notify individuals receiving housing assistance of their right to use absentee balloting and registration procedures under the Disaster Assistance Voting Act of 2009. The amendment applies to assistance received after the enactment of the Act.
